column4: how can i make ubuntu desktop into a LAMP server, is there a list of what I have to install?
also the p stands for python!
how can i change my DNS server permanently? it pisses me off that it always gets it from the dhcp server even when i change it again
do you have access to the DHCP server?
my router is bugged and returns 1.0.0.0 for DNS requests
then just set up the DNS servers in the dhcpd.conf
ah, it's a router, and i have set those up, it's not getting them
can i just set them up manually on the client?
are you talking a LOCAL dhcp server?  or your ISP?
actually, how can i set a static ip?
and you have a line like this in your dhcpd.conf:  option domain-name-servers 208.67.222.222, 208.67.220.220;
i configured it through its web interface
